page.title: 14Methodism - Tamar Valley
page.content: During the 19th century miners came to the villages and with them brought their Methodism. As the various groups of Methodism each built their own chapels they built three in Gunnislake, one at St Anne's Chapel and two at Albaston. The miners were Cornishmen who enjoyed singing and as there would be a congregation of two to three hundred each Sunday the singing must have been marvellous. As the mines closed down the miners moved and the chapels lost the congregations they had had. Now we only have two chapels in the area one at Gunnislake and one at Albaston and their total congregations are about 85. There is a Baptist Chapel at Metherell and the Salvation Army Church at Gunnislake has just closed.
